alert.note: Alert for Imperial County Southwest (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 17 at 2:47AM PDT until April 18 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM PDT TUESDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TUESDAY TO 5 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Advisory, southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. For the second Wind Advisory, west winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Southwest corner of Imperial County. * WHEN...For the first Wind Advisory, from 3 PM this afternoon to 5 AM PDT Tuesday. For the second Wind Advisory, from 1 PM Tuesday to 5 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne. Minor tree damage possible.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
